comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I think it is Fig Tree Point on the Lane Cove river.  The end of the ferry run, a popular swimming and picnic spot back in the day.  See other photos and links -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/8510450390/]  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/7069207257/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Red herring - there's a wonderful description of an 1889 ferry ride from the city to Fig Tree Point from the AT&CJ - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71121619/5435014, plus illustrations on p.26.
